byline.contributor: Alan Blinder and Richard Fausset reported from Dallas, and Richard Pérez-Peña from New York.
byline.original: By ALAN BLINDER, RICHARD FAUSSET and RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA

abstract: Dallas authorities remain wary after finding hoard of bomb-making materials in home of gunman Micah Johnson, who fatally shot five police officers; have not found explosives Johnson told police negotiators he had planted across city.
lead_paragraph: “The concern is we haven’t found something that’s out there,” the city’s police chief said Monday, referring to the gunman’s claims to have planted explosives.

headline.main: Dallas Gunman’s Plans for Bombing Remain a Worry for Police
headline.print_headline: Police Worry That Dallas Gunman Left Plans for Bombing Behind

snippet: “The concern is we haven’t found something that’s out there,” the city’s police chief said Monday, referring to the gunman’s claims to have planted explosives....
